name: William Carey
summary: English Christian missionary, Particular Baptist minister, translator, social reformer and cultural anthropologist who founded the Serampore College and the Serampore Mission.

biography.title: Early Life
biography.content: William Carey was born on 17 August 1761 in the village of Paulerspury in Northamptonshire, England. He was the eldest son of Edmund and Elizabeth Carey. His father worked as a parish clerk and village schoolmaster.

biography.title: Call to Missions
biography.content: Carey became deeply interested in missions after reading about Captain James Cook's voyages. In 1792, he preached his famous sermon containing the phrases 'Expect great things from God; attempt great things for God.'

biography.title: Mission to India
biography.content: In 1793, Carey sailed for India with his family. He established the Serampore Mission in 1800, which became a center for translation work, education, and social reform.

biography.title: Translation Work
biography.content: Carey translated the Bible into Bengali, Oriya, Hindi, Marathi, Sanskrit, and Assamese. He also translated parts of the Bible into 29 other languages.

timeline.description: William Carey was born in Northamptonshire, England
Converted to Baptist faith and began preaching
Helped establish the first English Baptist missionary organization
Departed for India as first missionary of the Baptist Missionary Society
Founded mission station that became center of Protestant missions in India
Established college for educating Christian ministers and teachers
Passed away after 41 years of missionary service in India

locations.name: Serampore, India
locations.description: Primary mission station and translation center

quiz.question: In which country did William Carey serve as a missionary?
quiz.explanation: William Carey served in India for 41 years, primarily at the Serampore Mission.

quiz.question: What famous phrase is associated with William Carey's missionary call?
options: Expect great things from God; attempt great things for God
quiz.explanation: This phrase from his 1792 sermon became the motto of modern missions.

quiz.question: How many languages did Carey translate the Bible into?
quiz.explanation: Carey translated the complete Bible into 6 languages and parts of it into 29 others.

quiz.question: What institution did Carey establish in 1818?
quiz.explanation: Serampore College was founded to train Christian ministers and teachers.

achievements: Translated Bible portions into 29 additional languages
Promoted social reforms including abolition of sati
